name: showananimal
0:
”Alexa, launch show an animal”
”show a cat”
”random”
skdetail:
This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: show an animal
des:
The skill allows to display on the screen of the device an image of the requested animal, when this animal is on the list. Just say "show me" followed by the name of the animal. For example, "show me a cat" will display a cat on the screen.

For some animals, the sound produced by the animal can also be heard. You can for example listen to the meowing of a cat or the roar of a lion if you ask for these animals.

It is possible to switch to "random" mode, that is to say that the skill will display the image of an animal present in its library of images, chosen randomly. Just say "random".

More than 230 animals are in the data library.

In the case of a dog, you can ask to see a dog, but you can also ask for a particular breed (a Dalmatian, a Pekingese or a chow chow for example). Not all breeds are necessarily present.

In the case of birds, a large list of birds is present in the library, including a lot of raptors.

You can ask to see relatively well-known animals like the horse, the cow, the lion, etc. An attempt has been made to be as precise as possible and in some cases to offer animals linked to the request. When you ask for a lizard, an image of a lizard will appear. The skill will indicate that the chameleon, gecko or iguana are also present in the database.

You will also find much lesser known animals like the lycaon, the okapi, the ocelot, the bearded vulture or the cassowary.


There is no image of fish, molluscs, insects, invertebrates in general, with a few exceptions such as the shark or the snail.
priv: The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
